That's actually real silver inside the ornaments since silver isn't nearly as rare as gold or platinum. If they coated the outsides instead of the insides the ornaments would soon tarnish because the surface would be exposed to the atmosphere. The way they do it the silver still tarnishes but on the inside of the coating where it can't be seen.

I'm surprised they don't use compressed air or at least a one way valve in their mouths. My father used to work as a glass blower in Germany and said once a guy there accidentally inhaled and scorched his lungs. He never saw him again and didn't know if he even survived.
All it takes is one momentary slip up and bang! You're left fighting for your life.

Growing up, Our Christmas Tree had such stunning, supremely beautiful ornaments. My Mom took great care of them, swathed each in cotton, protected by her, to unwrap the next Christmas just as beautiful. She would also decorate, upscale some of the ornaments with her personal touch. Made even more beautiful by her....And, Yes, old fashion tinsel put on ONE strand at a time. We had The Best, Most Beautiful Christmas Trees in The Entire World! Thanks Mom
